intro: Erodium malacoides var. subangulatum, commonly known as the narrow-angled bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are often narrowly elliptical in shape. The plant produces pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or along rocky outcrops. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Geraniaceae family.
